text: We should handle this gracefully: warn, but still run as if no vmax was passed.
title: plotting with vmax=nan crashes with a useless error
plotting with vmax=nan crashes with a useless error

text:
> I can take care of that.

Thanks!

> What is the usecase? Your tried to compute vmax yourself and your image had
> nans?

Not me, but the student with whom I am working did that.

> OK. Do you think that the error message should advise the user to use
> np.nan_max rather than np.max?

Yes, but I'd like to not have crasher, because sometimes there is a nan
in the data, and everything crashes which is a problem when you are
trying to analyse data.
I can take care of that.
Well, you had what you deserved :P
What is the usecase? Your tried to compute vmax yourself and your image had nans?
OK. Do you think that the error message should advise the user to use `np.nan_max` rather than `np.max`?
